examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) hako (box) no ookisa (size) wa dorekurai (how much) desu ka (?)

examples.sentence: 大きさはちょうどいいです
examples.romaji_meaning: Ookisa (Size) wa choudo (just right) ii (good) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 彼の考えは私と違います
examples.romaji: Kare no kangae wa watashi to chigaimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kare (His) no kangae (thoughts) wa watashi (me) to chigaimasu (are different)
examples.english: His thoughts are different from mine.

examples.sentence: この地図は役に立ちます
examples.romaji: Kono chizu wa yaku ni tachimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) chizu (map) wa yaku ni tachimasu (is useful)

examples.english: I get off at the station.
I will certainly keep my promise.

examples.sentence: 急に雨が降ってきました
examples.romaji: Kyuu ni ame ga futte kimashita
examples.romaji_meaning: Kyuu ni (Suddenly) ame (rain) ga futte kimashita (started falling)

examples.sentence: 新しい曲を聴きました
examples.english: I listened to a new song.

examples.sentence: 正しい答えはどれですか？
examples.romaji: Tadashii kotae wa dore desu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Tadashii (Correct) kotae (answer) wa dore (which) desu ka (?)

examples.sentence: 正しい方向に進みます
examples.english: I proceed in the correct direction.

examples.sentence: 細かいことを気にしないでください
examples.romaji: Komakai koto o ki ni shinaide kudasai
examples.romaji_meaning: Komakai (Minor) koto (things) o ki ni shinaide (don't worry about) kudasai (please)
examples.english: Please don't worry about minor things.

examples.sentence: 健康に気をつけてください
examples.romaji: Kenkou ni ki o tsukete kudasai
examples.romaji_meaning: Kenkou (Health) ni ki o tsukete (take care of) kudasai (please)
examples.english: Please take care of your health.

examples.sentence: 手伝ってくれますか？頼みます。
examples.romaji_meaning: Tetsudatte (Help) kuremasu ka (can you give help)? Tanomimasu (I ask for it).
examples.english: Can you help me? I ask for it.

examples.sentence: どうすればいいか困っています
examples.romaji: Dou sureba ii ka komatte imasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Dou sureba ii ka (what to do) komatte imasu (am in trouble)
examples.english: I am in trouble about what to do.

examples.sentence: ずっと待っていました

examples.english: We have been friends all along.

examples.sentence: 例えば、どんなものがありますか？
examples.romaji: Tatoeba, donna mono ga arimasu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Tatoeba (For example) donna (what kind) mono (things) ga arimasu ka (?)
examples.english: For example, what kind of things are there?

examples.sentence: 食べるつもりはありません
examples.romaji_meaning: Taberu (Eat) tsumori (intention) wa arimasen (do not have)
examples.english: I have no intention of eating.

examples.sentence: しばらくお待ちください
誰かを紹介してもらえませんか？
examples.romaji: Dareka o shoukai shite moraemasen ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Dareka (Someone) o shoukai (introduce) shite moraemasen ka (can I receive introduction)?

examples.english: I go to junior high school.

examples.sentence: 中学の時、サッカーをしていました
examples.romaji: Chuugaku no toki, sakkaa o shite imashita
examples.romaji_meaning: Chuugaku (Junior high school) no toki (time) sakkaa (soccer) o shite imashita (was playing)
examples.english: I played soccer during junior high school.

examples.sentence: 教科書をなくしました

examples.romaji_meaning: Seki (Seat) wa aite imasu (is empty) ka (?)

examples.english: I asked the teacher a question.

examples.sentence: 合格おめでとうございます
数字の数を教えてください
examples.romaji: Suuji no kazu o oshiete kudasai
examples.romaji_meaning: Suuji (Number) no kazu (number) o oshiete (teach) kudasai (please)
examples.english: Please tell me the number of digits.

examples.romaji: Kore wa suuji no hachi desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kore (This) wa suuji (number) no hachi (eight) desu (is)

examples.english: I hang a picture on the wall.

examples.sentence: 壁にポスターを貼りました
examples.english: I posted a poster on the wall.

examples.sentence: コップを落としました
私の代わりに彼が来ます
examples.romaji: Watashi no kawari ni kare ga kimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Watashi (My) no kawari ni (instead of) kare (he) ga kimasu (comes)
examples.english: He will come instead of me.
I am a junior high school student.

examples.romaji_meaning: Chuugakusei (Junior high school students) wa genki (energetic) desu (are)
examples.english: Junior high school students are energetic.

examples.sentence: この本はよく売れます
会議の日時が決まりました
examples.romaji_meaning: Kaigi (Meeting) no nichiji (date and time) ga kimarimashita (was decided)
examples.english: The date and time of the meeting were decided.

examples.sentence: クリスマスツリーを飾りました
友達にプレゼントを贈ります
examples.english: I send a gift to my friend.

examples.sentence: お祝いの気持ちを贈ります
examples.romaji: Oiwa i no kimochi o okurimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Oiwa i (Celebration) no kimochi (feelings) o okurimasu (send)

examples.sentence: タイピングを打ちます

examples.english: I place my shoes at the entrance.

examples.romaji_meaning: Ani (Older brother) to otouto (younger brother) ga imasu (there are)
examples.english: I have an older brother and a younger brother.

examples.sentence: 長男として責任があります
examples.romaji: Chounan to shite sekinin ga arimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Chounan (Eldest son) to shite (as) sekinin (responsibility) ga arimasu (there is)
examples.english: I have responsibility as the eldest son.
What is the height of this mountain?

examples.romaji_meaning: Kyuu you (Urgent business) ga arimasu (there is)

examples.sentence: 新しい時代が始まります

examples.english: I place it in this position.

examples.sentence: 正しい位置にあります
examples.english: It is in the correct position.

examples.sentence: どの季節が好きですか？
examples.romaji: Dono kisetsu ga suki desu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Dono (Which) kisetsu (season) ga suki (like) desu ka (?)
Kabe (Wall) ni ana (hole) ga arimasu (there is)
examples.english: There is a hole in the wall.
Please go around to the back.

examples.sentence: この紙の裏に書いてください
examples.romaji: Kono kami no ura ni kaite kudasai
examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) kami (paper) no ura (back) ni kaite (write) kudasai (please)
examples.english: Please write on the back of this paper.

examples.sentence: 科学技術が進んでいます
examples.romaji_meaning: Kagaku gijutsu (Science and technology) ga susunde imasu (is advancing)

examples.sentence: 台風に注意してください
examples.romaji_meaning: Taifuu (Typhoon) ni chuui (caution) shite kudasai (please pay)
examples.english: Please be careful of the typhoon.

examples.romaji_meaning: Kitakaze (North wind) ga fuite imasu (is blowing)

examples.sentence: この牛肉は美味しいです
この雑誌は面白いです
機械が故障しています
examples.romaji_meaning: Kikai (Machine) ga koshou shite imasu (is broken down)

examples.sentence: 親切にしてもらいました
先月、日本へ行きました
examples.english: I went to Japan last month.

examples.sentence: 先月、友達に会いました
examples.english: I met my friend last month.

examples.sentence: 一昨年、日本へ行きました
examples.romaji_meaning: Otokonoe (The year before last) Nihon (Japan) e ikimashita (went)
examples.english: I went to Japan the year before last.

examples.sentence: 一昨年の夏は暑かったです
examples.romaji: Otokonoe no natsu wa atsukatta desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Otokonoe (The year before last) no natsu (summer) wa atsukatta (was hot) desu (was)
examples.english: The summer the year before last was hot.

examples.romaji_meaning: Fuyuyasumi (Winter vacation) wa ie (home) ni imasu (stay)
examples.english: I stay home during winter vacation.

examples.sentence: 冬休みはいつからですか？
examples.romaji: Fuyuyasumi wa itsu kara desu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Fuyuyasumi (Winter vacation) wa itsu (when) kara (from) desu ka (?)
examples.english: When does the winter vacation start?

examples.romaji_meaning: Natsuyasumi (Summer vacation) wa itsu (when) desu ka (?)

examples.romaji: Kyuujitsu wa nani o shimasu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Kyuujitsu (Holiday) wa nani (what) o shimasu (do) ka (?)
examples.english: What do you do on holidays?

examples.sentence: 休日はゆっくりします
正月は実家に帰ります
examples.romaji_meaning: Shougatsu (New Year) wa jikka (parents' home) ni kaerimasu (return)
examples.english: I return to my parents' home for New Year.

examples.sentence: 正月は家族と過ごします
examples.romaji_meaning: Shougatsu (New Year) wa kazoku (family) to sugoshimasu (spend time)
examples.english: I spend New Year with my family.

examples.sentence: 昔のことを思い出しました
examples.romaji: Mukashi no koto o omoida shimashita
examples.romaji_meaning: Mukashi (Past) no koto (things) o omoida shimashita (remembered)
examples.english: I remembered things from the past.

examples.sentence: たまに友達と会います
その話はおかしいです
奥さんはお元気ですか？
赤ちゃんが生まれました
可愛い赤ちゃんですね
examples.english: It's a cute baby, isn't it?

examples.sentence: 小学生が遊んでいます
examples.romaji_meaning: Shougakusei (Elementary school student) ga asonde imasu (is playing)
examples.english: An elementary school student is playing.

examples.romaji_meaning: Shougakusei (Elementary school students) wa genki (energetic) desu (are)

examples.sentence: お金を貸してください
赤ちゃんが生まれました
黒い車が止まっています
examples.romaji_meaning: Kuroi (Black) kuruma (car) ga tomatte imasu (is stopped)

examples.sentence: 子供がおもちゃで遊んでいます
examples.romaji: Kodomo ga omocha de asonde imasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Kodomo (Child) ga omocha (toy) de asonde imasu (is playing)
examples.english: The child is playing with a toy.

examples.sentence: 新しい靴を買いました
会社に連絡してください
examples.romaji_meaning: Kaisha (Company) ni renraku (contact) shite kudasai (please do)

examples.sentence: お金を銀行に預けます
examples.english: I deposit money in the bank.

examples.sentence: プールで泳ぎましょう
あなたの趣味は何ですか？
examples.romaji: Anata no shumi wa nan desu ka?
examples.romaji_meaning: Anata (Your) no shumi (hobby) wa nan (what) desu ka (?)

examples.sentence: 幸せな家庭を築きたいです
examples.romaji: Shiawase na katei o tsukitai desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Shiawase (Happy) na katei (family) o tsukitai (want to build) desu (is)
examples.english: I want to build a happy family.

examples.sentence: 心配しないで、安心してください
examples.romaji_meaning: Shinpai (Worry) shinaide (don't do), anshin (relief) shite kudasai (please feel)

examples.sentence: 大勢の人が集まりました
examples.romaji_meaning: Oozei (Large number) no hito (people) ga atsumarimashita (gathered)
examples.english: A large number of people gathered.

examples.sentence: 会場には大勢いました
examples.english: There were many people at the venue.

examples.sentence: 医者にお世話になりました
examples.english: I was taken care of by the doctor.

examples.sentence: 運転手さんが来ました
運転手にお金を払います
